__data__.text:
"(Translated by Google) Nice first experience. The dishes are tasty and well presented. However, dishes that are <spicy> are not spicy at all (papaya salad, among others). Which is quite disappointing when you know Thai food. The bird peppers were not cut, so the salad was not spicy. The waitress was however very nice and the service outstanding.

(Original)
Belle première expérience. Les plats sont savoureux et bien présentés. Toutefois, les plats qui sont < épicés > ne le sont pas du tout ( salade papaye, en autres ). Ce qui est assez décevant quand tu connais la bouffe thaïe. Les piments oiseaux n’étaient pas coupés, donc la salade n’était pas relevée. La serveuse était toutefois très gentille et le service hors pair."
"Fabulous local spot. Low key, not fancy. Food speaks for itself. Share everything, ordered 8 dishes between 4 people and was right amount of food. Drink the orange wine!

Must try:
Sakoo Sai moo -
Tofu thoke -
Yum norma  farang"
Simply wonderful. Classic Thaï dishes meet local ingredients and the result is just perfect. Service is also impeccable and prices are really decent for the quality and quantity.
"Staff was disappointing, our server never gave me my change back and decided to tip herself 25%, never asked if I needed change in fact never came to check up if dishes were ok etc, one dish has a hair and we told her and she was very defensive saying it’s not the staffs hair because they have short hair…
Although the flavours were good , it’s overpriced for what you get . Won’t be going back because of the staff attitude."
"(Translated by Google) Wonderful tastes, new dining experience.. thank you.

(Original)
Merveilleux goûts, nouvelle expérience culinaire.. merci."
"3.5/5 star
Food was good, definitely not WOW besides the snow crab dish which was phenomenal! Found the staff quite rude and unapproachable. Don’t order the pork dish unless you enjoy your pork 75% fat."
"(Translated by Google) Concept of dishes to share
Everything was good. Relaxed and smiling staff. Very nice experience

(Original)
Concept de plats à partager
Tout était bon. Personnel relaxe et souriant. Très belle expérience"
The staff were rather rude and condescending.
"Excellent restaurant - spicy, tasty, fun, authentic & great service.
It's my GO TO restaurant whenever I want to go out :-)
Love how there is a fixed menu + temporary suggestions to change up the flavours."
Best service, wine, & food in town. We were a fairly large group for a birthday and they really went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience. Every staff member that night was super sweet and knowledgeable. Thanks guys 🫶
Tapioca dumplings, pork collar, papaya salad and the nam kang sai (shaved ice dessert) were so good! I would definitely come back to try other menu items!
"(Translated by Google) Incredible food and revisited Thai dishes! Also offers a nice range of natural wines. It's worth the detour.

(Original)
Bouffe incroyable et plats thailandais revisités! Offre également une belle gamme de vins natures. Ça vaut le détour."
Very good food. Amazing taste. Service and ambiance is worth it
Good food and service
"(Translated by Google) Wide choice of natural wines (very wide) and super well advised. Concept of dishes to share. Delicious, very filling. Great atmosphere.

(Original)
Large de choix de vins nature (très large) et super bien conseillé. Concept de

were so good! I would definitely come back to try other menu items!
"(Translated by Google) Incredible food and revisited Thai dishes! Also offers a nice range of natural wines. It's worth the detour.

(Original)
Bouffe incroyable et plats thailandais revisités! Offre également une belle gamme de vins natures. Ça vaut le détour."
Very good food. Amazing taste. Service and ambiance is worth it
Good food and service
"(Translated by Google) Wide choice of natural wines (very wide) and super well advised. Concept of dishes to share. Delicious, very filling. Great atmosphere.

(Original)
Large de choix de vins nature (très large) et super bien conseillé. Concept de plats  a partager. Délicieux, très copieux. Ambiance top."
"(Translated by Google) Wow a delight! Everything was perfect! Excellent service!

(Original)
Wow un délice! Tout était parfait! Service excellent!"
"(Translated by Google) Absolutely exquisite authentic papaya curry and salad!

(Original)
Curry et salade de papaye authentique absolument exquis !"
After a friend hyped this place, we went with him to try it out. We ordered many different plates but unfortunately, I didn't find anything particularly great. He's suspended from picking restaurants for the next year.
Delicious food and cocktails. Lovely atmosphere friendly staff
Authentic and delicious thai food!
"Awfull good … grossss
17.50 for a glass of wine
Do not go"
The food is delicious, authentic Thai flavors. Henri was charming and knowledgeable on all the all aperitif and wines. The pairings were perfect. So good that I’m coming back with a group of 14 ppl in 2 weeeks.
Super tasty, best to order a few dishes and go family style. The ribs, scallops, chicken, shrimp, and Tom yum were so good. Love this place
"Brilliant execution of Thai flavours with Quebec ingredients. The consistency between the dishes was most striking: the salads were desirably refreshing, the meat mains did not obscure one another, and the desserts were best in class.

Our table of 6 was served a blind tasting menu of 12 dishes, which included most of the chef’s specials along with a few of their classics. It suited the group perfectly in volume and shareability. We were able to cover many dishes but left much to look forward to."
"I absolutely love what they are doing!
Every single dish is just oozing and surprising with rich flavours.
It’s great how they managed to translate the Pumpui experience to a proper restaurant without loosing the layed back Bangkok eatery feel.
Love their natural wine selection as well.
If you had to choose just one dish on the menu as unmissable I would choose the Laab Ped.
Thank you for a great night!"
Absolutely an incredible experience and some of the most authentic Thai cuisine I’ve found outside of Northern Thailand. Between the incredible service and amazing foods and drinks, I highly recommend this spot!
So good. Curry was really flavourful and the perfect amount of spice. The steak and papaya salad were also mentionable. The Thai tea tiramisu slappppsss. So good that I keep thinking about it again. Creamy and crunchy. Pls order it
"(Translated by Google) No Phat Thai which is a really good sign and confirmed: The place is great, the recipes really good and the service very friendly (good advice) and a very nice wine list. On the other hand, be careful, most dishes are very spicy for ordinary mortals (me) and it is not really indicated on the menu so it may surprise you. But the flavors are really sublime if you can ignore it.

(Original)
Pas de Phat Thai ce qui est vraiment bon signe et confirmé : La place est super, les recettes vraiment bonnes et le

The steak and papaya salad were also mentionable. The Thai tea tiramisu slappppsss. So good that I keep thinking about it again. Creamy and crunchy. Pls order it
"(Translated by Google) No Phat Thai which is a really good sign and confirmed: The place is great, the recipes really good and the service very friendly (good advice) and a very nice wine list. On the other hand, be careful, most dishes are very spicy for ordinary mortals (me) and it is not really indicated on the menu so it may surprise you. But the flavors are really sublime if you can ignore it.

(Original)
Pas de Phat Thai ce qui est vraiment bon signe et confirmé : La place est super, les recettes vraiment bonnes et le service très sympathique (de bons conseils) et une très belle carte des vins. Par contre attention, la plupart des plats sont très épicés pour le commun des mortels (moi) et ce n’est pas vraiment indiqué sur le menu donc ça peut surprendre. Mais les saveurs sont vraiments sublimes si on peut passer outre."
"(Translated by Google) Excellent food, a variety of dishes far removed from Western Thai clichés. It succeeded!
⚠️WARNING: there are no totally non-spicy options. If you are sensitive you will not find your happiness even if they try to reduce the amount of pepper 🌶️ ⚠️

(Original)
Excellente nourriture, une variété de plats très loin des clichés thaïlandais occidentaux. C’est reussi!
⚠️WARNING: il n’y a pas d’options totalement non-épicées. Si vous êtes sensibles vous ne trouverez pas votre bonheur même s’ils essaient de réduire la quantité de piment 🌶️ ⚠️"
Most authentic Thai spot in Montreal. It is quite spicy though, you’ve been warned :)
Forget about pad thai or green curry, this place serves authentic Issan dishes, which is a region in Northern Thailand. My first time trying the regional cuisine but it was very delicious. Full of very strong flavors and spices using local ingredients.
"Great atmosphere for drinks and vibes, but this is NOT Thai food. Service was amazing and friendly, though!

Note to the chef; adding too much salt and basil leaves does not make it Thai. It lacks spice, flavour and balance."
"(Translated by Google) If I had overlooked the inattentive and curt service we received that evening, I would have had an almost perfect evening. I love to imbue my mouth with different flavors and the Pichai will amaze you (or rather, your taste buds!) Spicy until satiety, dishes of high quality and unusual around here (forget Thai Express).

One of the cheapest dishes appealed to me the most. The Kay Loog Koy (9 dollars) for very tasty little bites. Moreover, the rice that accompanies the dishes is skilfully prepared with very intriguing textures in the mouth. As for desserts, do not miss, if available, the essential tiramisu, light as a cloud.

The decor will also seduce you and put you in the mood. It exudes an impression of professionalism and a certain sophistication.

Sit down and take dishes without breaking your head too much. You are in excellent hands. My only regret is that the service was not up to par. However, it seems that this is not a recurring problem.

(Original)
Si j'avais fait abstraction du service inattentif et sec qu'on a reçu cette soirée-là, j'aurais passé une soirée presque parfaite. J'adore imprégner ma bouche de saveurs différentes et le Pichai vous en met plein la vue (ou

for desserts, do not miss, if available, the essential tiramisu, light as a cloud.

The decor will also seduce you and put you in the mood. It exudes an impression of professionalism and a certain sophistication.

Sit down and take dishes without breaking your head too much. You are in excellent hands. My only regret is that the service was not up to par. However, it seems that this is not a recurring problem.

(Original)
Si j'avais fait abstraction du service inattentif et sec qu'on a reçu cette soirée-là, j'aurais passé une soirée presque parfaite. J'adore imprégner ma bouche de saveurs différentes et le Pichai vous en met plein la vue (ou plutôt, plein les papilles!) Du piquant jusqu'à satiété, des plats d'une grande qualité et peu communs par ici (oubliez le Thaï Express).

Un des plats les moins chers m'a le plus séduit. Le Kay Loog Koy (à 9 dollars) pour de petites bouchées très savoureuses. D'ailleurs, le riz qui accompagne les plats est habilement préparé avec des textures très intrigantes en bouche. Du côté des desserts, ne manquez pas, si disponible, l'indispensable tiramisu, léger comme un nuage.

Le décor saura également vous séduire et vous mettre dans l'ambiance. Il s'en dégage une impression de professionnalisme et une sophistication certaine.

Assoyez-vous et prenez des plats sans trop vous casser la tête. Vous êtes entre d'excellentes main. Mon seul regret est que le service ne fut pas à la hauteur. Cependant, il semble que ce ne soit pas un problème récurrent."
"(Translated by Google) I remember what I ate and it was both original (for someone not versed in Thai cooking) and tasty. I really want to believe that there are only great wines on the menu, but I think there should be more affordable choices, nothing less than $65 a bottle, $15-16 by the glass. Fairly relaxed atmosphere, quite noisy.

(Original)
Je me souviens de ce que j'ai mangé et c'était à la fois original (pour quelqu'un qui n'est pas versé dans l'art culinaire thaïlandais) et savoureux. Je veux bien croire qu'il n'y a que des vins extras sur la carte mais je pense qu'il devrait y avoir des choix plus abordables, rien a moins de 65$ la bouteille, au verre 15-16$. Ambiance assez relax, assez bruyante."
"(Translated by Google) I really enjoyed my experience at Pichai! Nice variety of flavors and texture. The dishes were very fresh and spicy to perfection. The street food concept is very successful. I recommand it !

(Original)
J'ai beaucoup aimé mon expérience au Pichai ! Belle diversité de saveurs et de texture. Les plats étaient très frais et épicé à souhait. Le concept bouffe de rue est très réussi. Je le recommande !"
Great authentic Thai food, great service, great ambiance! Highly recommend
"Some interesting food options and the relatively small menu gives you various Thai options to choose.

Also has quite the wine list."
Outstanding thai food! All the items were spicy so be ready for the challenge. We were only 2 so we shared 3 dishes and a dessert. Definitely coming back with a group to try the rest of the menu.
Yummy Thai-inspired dishes, great wines... however the restaurant can be as noisy as a bar, and we found it was a bit

au Pichai ! Belle diversité de saveurs et de texture. Les plats étaient très frais et épicé à souhait. Le concept bouffe de rue est très réussi. Je le recommande !"
Great authentic Thai food, great service, great ambiance! Highly recommend
"Some interesting food options and the relatively small menu gives you various Thai options to choose.

Also has quite the wine list."
Outstanding thai food! All the items were spicy so be ready for the challenge. We were only 2 so we shared 3 dishes and a dessert. Definitely coming back with a group to try the rest of the menu.
Yummy Thai-inspired dishes, great wines... however the restaurant can be as noisy as a bar, and we found it was a bit overpriced.
Fried rice is 👍
"(Translated by Google) An excellent evening under the influence of magnificent Thai dishes.
The discovery of ingredients never tasted until today brings a most pleasant surprise effect.
A dynamic, joyful and efficient team completes the experience.

(Original)
Une excellente soirée sous l’effet de magnifiques plats thaïlandais.
La découverte d’ingrédients jamais goûtés jusqu’à aujourd’hui amène un effet de surprise des plus agréable.
Une équipe dynamique, joyeuse et efficace complète l’expérience."
Wicked spicy! Like if you are Thai you’ll be fine but if you are not Thai and don’t eat a lot of traditional Thai food you might need to take it easy on the papaya salad. That said, everything was so delicious. The pork collar and the swordfish curry were dope. Very natural wines, honestly not sure if they are the best match for this kind of food because they are usually so sharp and light. At any rate, I’d definitely go back.
Overall great with creative menu
Severely disappointed with my meal at Pichai. Was really looking forward to some elevated thai food, but the food did not live up to the hype nor the price. The sauce on my shrimp dish was so salty, it was practically inedible, could not even taste a hint of the sweet shrimp. Service was great and decor was super pretty, but would not recommend for the food.
One of the most memorable dinners of my life. The cocktails were amazing—so perfectly balanced. The food blew my mind. Everything was so flavourful and the presentation was beautiful. I loved the interior. We sat at the bar and had the best night ever. The server also recommended a great spot for us to go have a nightcap after. Can’t wait to come back here!
Just excellent.
A very cozy, lively restaurant with big flavourful dishes, complex recipes in shareable portions that create an intimate ambiance which we really enjoyed. Thorough, usefully knowledgeable service makes it very easy to pick the perfect meal for you
Delicious flavours. All dishes were meant to be shared. Only problem my girlfriend and I had is that we ordered too much. The spicy relish with squash was a highlight. Also loved the crab fried rice. Will definitely be going back to try all the dishes.
The place was PACKED! I've been wanting to try this place for a while now. I was not disappointed. Food was great! Service was great! I'll definitely go back. I suggest you try it if you like Thai food!
Incredibly tasty and friendly staff. Def recommend
"For appetizers, we had the sticky rice balls and the fish balls. The sticky rice balls were good and the fish balls were really good. I am not a huge fan of sticky rice so the sticky rice did not leave a lasting impression on me. We also had the scallop salad and the papaya salad. The scallops were spicy and flavourful. They pack quite a punch in terms of heat and flavour. I would definitely recommend it.

Some other dishes we ordered include: Vegetarian taro and tofu

all the dishes.
The place was PACKED! I've been wanting to try this place for a while now. I was not disappointed. Food was great! Service was great! I'll definitely go back. I suggest you try it if you like Thai food!
Incredibly tasty and friendly staff. Def recommend
"For appetizers, we had the sticky rice balls and the fish balls. The sticky rice balls were good and the fish balls were really good. I am not a huge fan of sticky rice so the sticky rice did not leave a lasting impression on me. We also had the scallop salad and the papaya salad. The scallops were spicy and flavourful. They pack quite a punch in terms of heat and flavour. I would definitely recommend it.

Some other dishes we ordered include: Vegetarian taro and tofu red curry, duck confit curry, vermicelli bowl, braised pork and I believe  a laarb dish. The sauce used in the duck co fit was  very similar to the red curry and I was not really a fan of it. The duck itself was soft and fall off the bone tender. I quite enjoyed the vermicelli bowl, but I thought the vermicelli used was a little too thin. It was hard to differentiate between noodle other ingredients once everything was mixed together. The braised pork was tasty and reminiscent of a dish I had growing up; the dish was salty and a little sour from the vinegar.

For dessert, we ordered one of each item. I enjoyed the mango sorbet the most since it was a nice way to cut the richness from the rest of the meal. The tiramisu was also really delicious and had a nice toasted flavour."
First is all, the lights were very dim so we couldn’t see what we were eating. Food is not only taste and smell but also colour. The place was overheated. Someone remarked that it felt as if we were in Thailand. As for the food, it was fine but too spicy even though we asked for not too spicy.
This is the best and my favorite restaurant in Montreal. Every time I show up here, I'm impressed with the seasonal menu. It's sometimes delicate, most times an uppercut of flavors to your face. As long as they keep it fresh, I will continue to visit this place. It's too bad I can only taste so many dishes every time.
"(Translated by Google) Good food, but the plates contain next to nothing for the price. We will also recommend 3 to 4 plates for 2 people - I was surprised given the price. No bottles of wine for less than $65-70 are offered, and by the glass it will cost you at least $15-16.
We ordered 3 plates for 2 people, including 2 veg/vegan (and therefore cheaper because without meat - my friend is a vegetarian) and a bottle of wine ($78 - not many options unless that).
Bill: $185 (includes 15% tip). My friend ate reasonably (and doesn't have a big appetite), and that's fine because I let him swallow almost everything from the plates: I was inviting him over for his birthday. I came back with an empty stomach.
So yes I liked it, but won't go back there considering the prices which are exaggerated from my point of view. I have eaten just as well and cheaper elsewhere.

(Original)
Bonne nourriture, mais les assiettes ne contiennent pratiquement rien pour le prix. On vous recommandera d'ailleurs 3 à 4 assiettes pour 2 personnes - j'étais surprise vu le prix. Pas de bouteilles de vin à moins de 65-70$ d'offerte, et au verre il vous en coûtera au minimum 15-16$.
Nous avons commandé 3 assiettes pour 2 personnes, dont 2 végé/végan (et donc moins chères car sans viande - mon ami est végétarien) et une bouteille de vin (78$ - pas beaucoup d'options à moins que cela).
Facture : 185$ (inclue le pourboire de 15%). Mon ami a

nourriture, mais les assiettes ne contiennent pratiquement rien pour le prix. On vous recommandera d'ailleurs 3 à 4 assiettes pour 2 personnes - j'étais surprise vu le prix. Pas de bouteilles de vin à moins de 65-70$ d'offerte, et au verre il vous en coûtera au minimum 15-16$.
Nous avons commandé 3 assiettes pour 2 personnes, dont 2 végé/végan (et donc moins chères car sans viande - mon ami est végétarien) et une bouteille de vin (78$ - pas beaucoup d'options à moins que cela).
Facture : 185$ (inclue le pourboire de 15%). Mon ami a mangé raisonnablement (et n'a pas grand appétit), et c'est bien parce que je l'ai laissé presque tout avaler des assiettes : je l'invitais pour son anniversaire.  Moi je suis revenue l'estomac encore creux.
Donc oui j'ai aimé, mais n'y retournerai pas vu les prix qui sont de mon point de vue exagéré. J'ai mangé tout aussi bien et moins cher ailleurs."
Fun atmosphere but one time I went the food was so salty my family could barely eat it. A shame because it’s otherwise wonderful food, someone in the kitchen was just too heavy handed that night.
"(Translated by Google) Great meal

(Original)
Excellent repas"
Highly recommended by two locals, figured it was an absolute must. And they were right. Fun and delicious food and drink. Vegan options are delicious as well. Extensive wine last, friendly and attentive staff, cool people and good times. Don’t hesitate.
Quite good. Amazingly authentic fiery Thai dishes. The Pla rad prik was especially delicious. A little pricey overall but the quality is there so not a bad value proposition....but definitely not a good one. At 126$ per person (incl tax and tip), it's a little on the pricey side. Cheapest bottles on the wine list start in the 70$ range. But that said, solid Thai fair, bold flavors. Will go back with less of an appetite.
This is whitewashed thaï food. Not authentic at all and overpriced
Next level delicious and absolutely perfect wine. We shared a tiramisu that I am still dreaming of. staff was awesome. 🙏 Thank you
"(Translated by Google) Restaurant visited for dinner: a little mixed. The service is cool and the dishes offered are very good in principle, but we found it overall expensive for what it is. We were told that the concept was to share the dishes, which was not indicated at the start, as a result we end up with 5 dishes for 3 (which was recommended to us -> a bit much + the bill climbs quickly) . Nice to have tested but I don't think I'll go back.

(Original)
Restau visité pour un diner : un peu mitigée. Le service est cool et les plats proposés sont très bons sur le principe mais nous avons trouvé ça globalement cher pour ce que c’est. On nous a expliqué que le concept était de partager les plats, ce qui n’était pas indiqué au départ, résultat nous nous retrouvons avec 5 plats pour 3 (ce qui nous a été recommandé -> un peu beaucoup + la note grimpe vite). Sympa d’avoir testé mais je ne pense pas y retourner."
"I am SE Asian and I can confirm that this place does Thai food VERY WELL—was massively impressed with their dishes. It's tapas/family style so it's recommended to order 1-2 items per person.

We ordered the Mushroom Salad, Stir-Fried Cabbage (which sounds plain but is super amazing), and the Strip Loin, all served with traditional sticky rice and

a expliqué que le concept était de partager les plats, ce qui n’était pas indiqué au départ, résultat nous nous retrouvons avec 5 plats pour 3 (ce qui nous a été recommandé -> un peu beaucoup + la note grimpe vite). Sympa d’avoir testé mais je ne pense pas y retourner."
"I am SE Asian and I can confirm that this place does Thai food VERY WELL—was massively impressed with their dishes. It's tapas/family style so it's recommended to order 1-2 items per person.

We ordered the Mushroom Salad, Stir-Fried Cabbage (which sounds plain but is super amazing), and the Strip Loin, all served with traditional sticky rice and regular white rice.

Highly recommend this place. Will be going back soon."
"(Translated by Google) I didn't like it at all.
Not even classic pad thai on the menu...
Handwriting on a second menu where we read Ravioles and in fact they are Rabioles (mushrooms).
What we ordered was very spicy when we were told it was not very spicy.
4 very small pieces of meat in one of the dishes we had...
Very expensive for what it is, and no more taste, fortunately there is rice to accompany.
I won't be going back.

(Original)
Je n'ai pas du tout aimé.
Meme pas de pad thai classique sur le menu...
Ecriture a la main sur un second menu où on lit Ravioles et en fait ce sont des Rabioles (champignons).
Ce qu'on a commandé etait très epicé alors qu'on nous a dit que c'etait très peu epicé.
4 tous petits morceaux de viande dans un des plats qu'on a pris...
Très cher pour ce que c'est, et goût sans plus, heureusement qu'il y'a le riz pour accompagner.
Je n'y retournerai pas."
Fabulous Thai food, lovely wine list.
This is now my favorite neighborhood restaurant. The chef deftly replicates the subtle tastes of genuine Thai cuisine — not the often bland and overly sweet North American version it — while at the same time innovating. The service is friendly and discreet.
An incredible dining experience from start to finish. There’s a wine selection, and a menu or monthly specials in addition to the more permanent menu fixtures. We were blown away by the laab ped and the tapioca dumplings with pork, and though we were pretty stuffed by dessert, I had to try the banana sundae—it was the perfect end to the meal, and one of the best desserts I’ve ever eaten.
Service was ok. We ordered the mushrooms salad and the duck larb which were both excellent. The papaya salad was too sour and we left it untouched. No apologies or any remarks about the salad when we told the staff.  We ordered a shrimp dish also that was a but too salty.
"French gastronomy meets Thai food? Well it makes for some superbly refined and delicious plates with a middle high price tag associated with it.

Savory layered bites, favs and monthly specials in a great intimate dining space with awesome hosts.

Loving it."
Amazing food !!
"A little hidden gem on Saint-Hubert offers well-presented Thai dishes. Service is quick and well-intentioned.

We suggest to reserve a place, we reserve later in the evening and arrived in advance. However they were able to find us a cosy place nonetheless.

They suggest 3-4 dishes for a party of 2 that are shareable. We left the restaurant satisfied with the amount of food we eat."
"(Translated by Google) Extra waiter and delicious food

(Original)
Serveur extra et nourriture délicieuse"
Terrific food and service in English and French. Parfait.
"(Translated by

layered bites, favs and monthly specials in a great intimate dining space with awesome hosts.

Loving it."
Amazing food !!
"A little hidden gem on Saint-Hubert offers well-presented Thai dishes. Service is quick and well-intentioned.

We suggest to reserve a place, we reserve later in the evening and arrived in advance. However they were able to find us a cosy place nonetheless.

They suggest 3-4 dishes for a party of 2 that are shareable. We left the restaurant satisfied with the amount of food we eat."
"(Translated by Google) Extra waiter and delicious food

(Original)
Serveur extra et nourriture délicieuse"
Terrific food and service in English and French. Parfait.
"(Translated by Google) Honestly not full good.

(Original)
Honnêtement pas full bon."
"(Translated by Google) We were disappointed given the rating of the establishment 😕
Between the shrimp salad with (really) 2 shrimp, the noodles which were covered with about 15 basil leaves and which were drenched in the sauce which in addition were not incredible ... the cuisine was not worth the rating of 4 ,7

(Original)
On a été déçu vu la note de l'établissement 😕
Entre la salade au crevette avec (vraiment) 2 crevettes, les nouilles qui etaient recouvertes d'environ 15 feuilles de basilic et qui beignaient dans la sauce qui en plus n'etaient pas incroyables ... la cuisine ne valait pas la note de 4,7"
"(Translated by Google) I've wanted to try it for a long time. It was delicious and above all filling. 2 starters or main courses per person is enough and you can order something else if needed. The cocktails of the day were really original and good. The impeccable service! To do absolutely!

(Original)
Ca faisait longtemps que je voulais l'essayer. C'était délicieux et surtout copieux. 2 entrées ou plats par personne cest suffisant et vous pouvez commander autre chose au besoin. Les cocktails du jour était vraiment originaux et bons. Le service impeccable! À faire absolument!"
"(Translated by Google) A M A Z I N G!!!
Already my new favorite restaurant ♥️
What an explosion of flavors, I can't wait to go back

(Original)
A M A Z I N G!!!
Déjà mon nouveau resto préféré ♥️
Quelle explosion de saveurs, je hâte d’y retourner"
This was among the top 3 best meals of my life. Every dish was delicious. It’s so much more than traditional Thai food - it’s innovative and modern yet down to earth and casual. The family-style tasting menu is the perfect format for sampling a plethora of titillating tastes. The staff is not only knowledgeable about food and beverage menu but also friendly, cool and able to give recommendations about other local establishments. 10/10 would recommend
This place was fantastic! All the flavors and combinations were delicious! The staff was super nice and friendly. I liked that the concept they manage is "everything to share" because you can order several dishes and try a bit of everything. We ordered the Luk Shin Plaa Tod (fried fish balls), the Some Tam Thai (classic green papaya salda) and the SII Krong Neua (a seasonal dish made of short beef ribs). We were very happy with everything. To dring they have a wide selection of good wines. The only note that I would add is that if you are not used to spicy food be careful with the dishes marked as "spicy" or the dishes that contain chili sauce. I love spicy food and I found it spicy (in a good way) so I believe that for someone not used to it can be too much. We finished with the Tiramisu Cha Yen (a tea thai

friendly. I liked that the concept they manage is "everything to share" because you can order several dishes and try a bit of everything. We ordered the Luk Shin Plaa Tod (fried fish balls), the Some Tam Thai (classic green papaya salda) and the SII Krong Neua (a seasonal dish made of short beef ribs). We were very happy with everything. To dring they have a wide selection of good wines. The only note that I would add is that if you are not used to spicy food be careful with the dishes marked as "spicy" or the dishes that contain chili sauce. I love spicy food and I found it spicy (in a good way) so I believe that for someone not used to it can be too much. We finished with the Tiramisu Cha Yen (a tea thai tiramisu) which was a completely new tiramisu experience!
Delicious! Their red curry panang was to die for!
"(Translated by Google) Excellent ""spicy"" meal and the service was absolutely on point!

(Original)
Excellent repas « épicé » et le service était tout à fait à la hauteur!"
Amazing experience! We were 6, we shared plates and it was so good! Would come back for sure!
The dishes were loaded with playful spicy and subtle flavours and textures, light and fresh but also satisfying like comfort food. I was so full and happy after the corn salad and eggplant salad (which came with a nice portion of sticky rice to soak up the sauce) off the temporary specials menu. I’ll be back to try more dishes soon :)
"(Translated by Google) Not cheap, but really original cuisine. Nothing to do with what you know of the usual Thai cuisine. Nice experience. I recommend the swordfish dish! Really very good!

(Original)
Pas donné, mais cuisine vraiment originale. Rien a voir avec ce que vous connaissez de la cuisine Thai habituelle. Belle expèrience. Je vous recommande le plât d'espadon ! Vraiment très bon !"
"(Translated by Google) Interesting dishes that are worth a detour. However, what is remembered most is the very attentive and prompt service. We had a very nice evening and we will go back with our family without hesitation 🥰

(Original)
Plats intéressants qui méritent le détour. Cependant, ce dont on se souvient le plus est le service très attentionné et rapide. Nous avons passé une très belle soirée et on va y retourner avec notre famille sans hésiter 🥰"
Had 5 dishes, two tasty cocktails and a bottle of wine for a bit over $200 all in for two people sitting bar seats. Flavours on the food and drinks were vibrant and delicious. Well worth it for some tasty food in a fun casual environment.
"(Translated by Google) Very good Thai food, definitely worth a visit. Only problem; I would have liked our waitress to warn us that one of the dishes we ordered (scallop curry) was super spicy. We were only told it was just hot (and we like spicy things), when it was really on another level. We finally barely touched the dish so much our mouth was on fire. Damage.

This restaurant is so good. It's crazy! We shared 4 dishes and wow. Amazing! The dishes are of very high quality, the presentation beautiful and the service impeccable."
"Superbe paysage de saveurs relevées et variées. Le repas était excellent, surtout le plat de porc épicé.

Carte de vin épurée, mais excellente sélection avec des producteurs au top de leur art.

En plus de tout ça le service est bon et les prix sont vraiment compétitifs par rapport à la qualité des produits.

Nb, les gens qui ne tolèrent absolument pas le piquant, soyez prudents à ce que vous commandez ou prenez votre temps.

On reviendra

(Translated by Google)
Superb landscape of spicy and varied flavors. The meal was excellent, especially the spicy pork dish.

Clean wine list, but excellent selection with producers at the top of their game.

On top of all that the service is good and the prices are really competitive compared to the quality of the products.

Nb, people who are totally intolerant of spiciness, be careful what you order or take your time.

We will come back"
"Great take on Thai food.

There's a lot of good options to try and they have a specials menu full of we extra dishes.

The place is lively but not too loud.

The food is delicious, but be warned that it is spicy. I love spicy food and the overall meal was borderline too hot for me (I loved it). No single dish was too spicy, it was the accumulation of spicy dishes for over an hour. They have a good wine menu, a small selection of quality beers and a few exotic (ish)

game.

"Great take on Thai food.

There's a lot of good options to try and they have a specials menu full of we extra dishes.

The place is lively but not too loud.

The food is delicious, but be warned that it is spicy. I love spicy food and the overall meal was borderline too hot for me (I loved it). No single dish was too spicy, it was the accumulation of spicy dishes for over an hour. They have a good wine menu, a small selection of quality beers and a few exotic (ish) cocktails.

You should go for 3-4 dishes for 2 people. We went for 5 and it was too much food. Our highlights were the mushroom salad
and the grilled pork.

Service was fast and our sever was friendly and helped us navigate the menu well."
"Un mariage parfait de saveurs thaï et d'aliments du Québec, avec une carte des vins super intéressante. Nous avons pris les boulettes de poissons, la salade de maïs, la salade de champignons : tout était frais, savoureux et bien relevé! Le service est rapide, professionel, bref, impeccable (et nous y sommes allés un vendredi soir très occupé). Va falloir revenir en groupe comme ça se prête mieux au format ''plats à partager''.

(Translated by Google)
A perfect marriage of Thai flavors and foods from Quebec, with a super interesting wine list. We took the fish balls, the corn salad, the mushroom salad: everything was fresh, tasty and well seasoned! Service is fast, professional, brief, impeccable (and we went on a very busy Friday night). We'll have to come back as a group as it lends itself better to the ''dishes to share'' format."
"Savoureux petits plats d’inspiration thaï avec une utilisation inventive des épices. Nous avons été très bien conseillés par notre hôtesse Sandrine. Joli selection de vins. On reviendra!

(Translated by Google)
Tasty Thai-inspired dishes with an inventive use of spices. We were very well advised by our hostess Sandrine. Nice selection of wines. We will be back!"
Food was great!! Lots of flavours. The Espadon red curry was deliciousssss but the fish could of been softer which shows signs of being overcooked. The curry sauce has a very strong curry and coconut taste, amazing with rice. The sparkling red wine was great as well. It went well with what we ate. Only thing I didn’t like was that my waitress , as she opened my sparkling red wine , it blew everywhere. Also , when she poured my glass, it was all over the place. It wasn’t a “expensive” bottle but still it was 70$, it’s not pleasant to see your bottle being poured like this. I was 7 years waiter before and I never waste customer’s wine like this even if it was a 30$ bottle.
"I would take a plane from Toronto to Montreal just to eat their ลาบเป็ด roasted duck salad again. It was super authentic and worth the price. Each bite transported me to Northeastern Thailand.

I also ordered Sai Krok Issan and the corn som tum (not pictured) the sausages were nice and savoury. The corn salad is their take on the classic Thai papaya salad made with vegetables grown in Quebec. The veggies are crunchy and super fresh.

"I would take a plane from Toronto to Montreal just to eat their ลาบเป็ด roasted duck salad again. It was super authentic and worth the price. Each bite transported me to Northeastern Thailand.

I also ordered Sai Krok Issan and the corn som tum (not pictured) the sausages were nice and savoury. The corn salad is their take on the classic Thai papaya salad made with vegetables grown in Quebec. The veggies are crunchy and super fresh.

The staff are so nice and welcoming. This place can get crowded, but I didn’t feel rushed at all. I would describe the menu as elevated Thai cuisine, with a focus on locally sourced ingredients. I am fully convinced that Pichai is the best Thai restaurant in Canada. This is coming from someone who has Thai friends and cooks Thai food at home.

I wish they had ตำปูปลาร้า and ก้อยไข่มดแดง. Please consider putting more Isaan food on the menu. Merci beaucoup ขอบคุณค่ะ"
"(Translated by Google) Great restaurant! I had the mushroom salad and the fish balls which were excellent. My friends ordered the curried swordfish and a dish with meat (both gluten free).
The cocktails are very good and quite light. I particularly recommend the tequila and lime cocktail.
Warning: the dishes are extremely spicy for people who are not used to it.
The price is affordable; count $15 for a cocktail and about twenty dollars for a dish.
I would definitely come back!

(Original)
Excellent restaurant ! J'ai pris la salade de champignons et les fish balls qui étaient excellents. Mes amis ont commandé l'espadon au curry et un plat avec de la viande (les deux sans gluten).
Les cocktails sont très bons et assez légers. Je recommande particulièrement le cocktail tequila et lime.
Attention : les plats sont extrêmement épicés pour les personnes qui n'ont pas l'habitude.
Le prix est abordable ; comptez 15$ pour un cocktail et environ une vingtaine de dollars pour un plat.
Je reviendrais sans hésiter !"
I’ve been 5 times and still want to go back. The food is beyond amazing, the service and drinks are great. Great for gluten-free & vege/pescatarians!
